extendedInfo.description: 9/10 Eurogamer --- Game of the Week - âPerhaps the most visually stunning shooter ever madeâ 9/10 IGN --- âEverything fans expect is here in Sine Mora.â 8.5/10 Gamespot --- âOne of the best XBLA titles this year.â 9.5/10 Destructoid --- "One of the most aesthetically-pleasing, fun, and thought-provoking games to come out in some time." 91/100 GameTrailers --- "Sine Mora's unforgettable mechanics and presentation bring the genre kicking and screaming back into the spotlight." After conquering PC, XBLA, PS3 and iOS, the cult classic shoot-em-up has finally arrived to Android! Fusing frantic, innovative gameplay from Digital Reality with stunning graphical design from Grasshopper Manufacture, Sine Mora set a new high standard for shmups and gained widespread acclaim. Strap yourself in and get ready for a breathtaking adventure! Sine Mora is a horizontal shoot'em up that provides a unique take on challenge, where time is the ultimate factor. Mixing classic shooter sensibilities with contemporary presentation, Sine Mora is a gorgeous shoot'em up that offers a Story Mode that weaves an over-the-top tale and an Arcade Mode that provides deep, satisfying gameplay to challenge fans of the genre. With many ways to manipulate time, Sine Mora features over 50 weapon combinations to complete each beautiful stage that form fits to the player's skills with scaling difficulty. Soundtrack composed by Akira Yamaoka and featuring boss designs by Mahiro Maeda. - Engrossing story integrated seamlessly into the action to elevate the user experience - Unique, time extension based gameplay - 7 beautifully crafted, diverse stages - Over 50 different weapon combinations with time manipulating devices - Four different control schemes: virtual joystick, floating joystick, relative touch control or reversed relative touch.- Great accessibility - Story Mode is tailored to not scare away absolute newcomers to the genre - Risk and reward - multiple difficulty levels in Arcade Mode with deep scoring and hidden rank system for the more experienced players - Music composed by Akira Yamaoka, Sound Director of Silent Hill and Shadows of the Damned - Featuring boss designs by Mahiro Maeda, one of the most prominent Japanese anime creators (Blue Submarine No. 6, The Animatrix - The Second Renaissance, Kill Bill: Vol. 1)

reviews.title: I think it\'s great!
reviews.comment: Smooth gameplay, sweet graphics, fine controls on tablet, overall a great game! Kudos to the devs.
reviews.author: Michael Alfaro

reviews.title: Very very very very very
reviews.comment: Awesome! Nothing in the android market that matches this kind of quality.   I give it 5 star but for leader boards online I don\'t use Facebook.   Still 5 stars because the story and game is just that good.
reviews.author: Chris S

reviews.title: Could be a great game
reviews.comment: NEEDS NVIDIA SHIELD SUPPORT! Then it will get my first perfect score. Would love to play this game with real controller support.
reviews.author: Lord Rahl

reviews.title: Nice graphic
reviews.comment: Its nice looking and all but the gameplay need to be casual player friendly
reviews.author: Imran Tahir

reviews.title: Nice game, but hard to control
reviews.comment: Please make fullscreen, and relative touch screen sync with our finger or stylus, because its hard to control with dpad or relative touch screen you provide now.. Will give 3 star for now, until better control. Thanks  :D
reviews.author: Maulana Sastradipradja

reviews.title: Terrible Controls!
reviews.comment: great graphics, gameplay etc rendered unplayable by terrible controls.  developer should try other shooters to see how sensitive a good control should be
reviews.author: Marcus Tang

reviews.title: Great game
reviews.comment: Thank you for a great game that I can take with me everywhere, love android
reviews.author: Isaac Madearis

reviews.title: Visually Stunning but...
reviews.comment: Difficult to control even on the Nexus 4\'s 4.7\" screen, not helped by the small playing area which is only about 2/3 of the screen; ultimately more a feast for the eyes than a truly enjoyable shooter. And you have AdMob ads in a paid app!?
reviews.author: Kevin Chan

reviews.title: Best game ive played in a long time!
reviews.comment: Great game, love the difficulty levels and the ganeplay is amazing! Dont do what I did which was wait for ages to buy it having it sit in my wishlist. Get it today!
reviews.author: Mark Walmsley

reviews.title: Black Screen
reviews.comment: Most people complain about bugs atleast you get to play the game. I bought it a few days ago please fix then rate 5 stars!
reviews.author: Fiachra Smith

reviews.title: One of the most polished shooters in years.
reviews.comment: Mobile gaming truly is getting serious when stuff like this gets ported. Fabulous visuals, high production values and a serious challenge. You\'ll just marvel at the detail in the level backgrounds and the game models. Let down slightly by the control options and no Google game support, but still an amazing release.
reviews.author: Sean Townsend

reviews.title: Addicted
reviews.comment: Quite easy to control. It provide few choices of control type. Floating controller suit me. Beautiful graphic. Have no problem playing on my Nexus 4.
reviews.author: Nicky Hing

reviews.title: Good but can be better
reviews.comment: Good game !! Control result s in make the difficulty too high , this make the whole experience of the game definitely possible to improve
reviews.author: Jacopo Battistello

reviews.title: Fantastic!
reviews.comment: Excellent quality game... Some tips for future releases. 1. Game is more suited to tablets, please have the game run in full screen with transparent stick and buttons and remove the bar that they currently sit on to maximise onscreen gameplay on phones. 2. Please add Google+ sign-in api as I\'m using Facebook less and less. Its a very intrusive system. Apart f on that, graphics, story and cut scenes are of the best quality!! Cheers
reviews.author: Darren De La Mare

reviews.title: Great game
reviews.comment: Beautiful game, amazing graphics and game play. Control could still be better. I\'m using relative toch as control and moving backwards or forward is just to slow, have to swipe multiple times to just be able to move backwards and pickup a power up. Please keep working on the controls and I\'ll give it the five stars it then truly deserves.
reviews.author: Bas Brouwers

reviews.title: IKARGUA AGAIN
reviews.comment: Have you guys played IKARUGA  on Dreamcast before, that is such a great  STG. Now I am very happy to find this game on my small android phone. Yes it\'s different from IKARUGA , but I have to say both two games are reach the peak of STG games. Truly diamonds!  I gave 4 stars instead of 5 because I wanna more work on the touch screen sensitive. After the recent update it works better! Buy I am still want to see it in a perfect status!  I am in China buy I managed to purchased this game just for the love!
reviews.author: Yuliang Li

reviews.title: Superlative Graphics, challenging controls
reviews.comment: =Summary= If you have root on your device, take the time to map some touch controls to your Moga or PS3 controller using Sixaxis or USB/BT Joy Center. Once Digital Reality implement native hardware controller support and give players back the screen real-estate they are missing, this game will be unbeatable in the shmup category.  =Long Version= So I\'ve tried all different control types now before writing this, and I have to say that probably the best out of the wretched bunch is Relative Touch. At least that way you can move the ship around the screen with a stylus instead of having to try and use the horrible virtual d-pad. Not to mention the weapon controls are arranged in a lineal arrangement which means your thumb often slips off the fire button. This game requires such precision in control to thread your way through bullet hell that anything less than a hardware joypad is going to mean you are \"going to have a bad time\". I\'m finding that even though Sine Mora has staggering graphics, I\'m drawn more towards Xelorians because that developer has *nailed* the controls on that game.  Digital Reality could do well to take a look at that app\'s control system.
reviews.author: Jared Morgan

reviews.title: Good Experience. Worth the price.
reviews.comment: One of the better games on Google Play for sure. nice high standard all round. controls seem o.k. its impossible to avoid all the myriad of bullets anyway! best to just tear in there ;)  game works well for me on N7 GFX and Design are excellent. gameplay is respectable so far. will add a star when I see Google play game centre integration. that would make it perfect.
reviews.author: Andrew Mclauchlan

reviews.title: I\'m not surprise if not many many people buy this game..
reviews.comment: The level is too hard to play, cant even enjoy the game at all.. pfft.. All u do just dodging and dodging.. and dodging the enemies bullets all the way.. Cant even see the beautifull of the effects.. Too busy dodging enemies projectiles.. not so much fun.. Good crisp graphics, but cant be enjoyed because of the difficulty.. You guys need to nerf the enemy\'s projectiles..
reviews.author: Sayed A.F

reviews.title: Superb shooter
reviews.comment: I\'m a first timer to this game and despite some stutter in graphics I was totally enthralled for the 30-40 minutes I played so far. The cutscenes, the bosses, the special weapons, the storyline and backgrounds are just superb. Moga support would definitely perfect my gaming experience. Worth every penny of the asking price and getting it on sale is just a steal. Eagerly looking forward to more optimizations.
reviews.author: Jo Mama
